snippet: If you are looking for equivalent Grand Slam disappointment, you will find Martina Navratilova, who won the first three legs of the Slam in 1984 only to be beaten in the Australian Open semifinals.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column compares upset of Serena Williams in United States Open finals to Roberta Vinci against other major upsets in tennis history.
lead_paragraph: If you are looking for equivalent Grand Slam disappointment, you will find Martina Navratilova, who won the first three legs of the Slam in 1984 only to be beaten in the Australian Open semifinals.

headline.print_headline: Calibrating the Shock Value of a Monumental Upset
headline.main: Calibrating the Shock Value of Serena Williams’s Monumental U.S. Open Loss
